summary: A metabolically engineered strain of E. coli was successfully used to produce the complex polyketide 6-deoxyerythronolide B (6dEB) with productivity comparable to a high-producing mutant of S. erythraea, demonstrating the potential for using E. coli as a host for producing complex natural products.
key_claims: A genetically engineered strain of E. coli was used to produce 6-deoxyerythronolide B (6dEB) with productivity comparable to a high-producing mutant of S. erythraea.

The production of 6dEB in E. coli requires overcoming challenges such as expressing correctly folded and posttranslationally modified modular polyketide synthases, providing necessary building blocks, and synchronizing enzyme activity with precursor biosynthesis.
